comments.body: @olegtarasov I see you are also the author of the code. Do you know about conda-lock? Is the code you use to figure out pip vs conda install something we could use to improve conda-lock?
@ocefpaf I found a better and less hacky way to get the list of pip packages. See here: https://github.com/olegtarasov/conda-export/blob/b363f508d52bd887f925536fba149d70c2fceb10/conda-export.py#L15

Nice! Simple and elegant. Thanks!

For conda-lock the main issue is that the env is not "realized" yet. In order to support pip packages there we would need to actually create the envs. While it is possible to do without it I'm not sure it is worth it. However, being able to figure out pip packages in an existing env is already a big win for the community. Thanks for conda-export!!

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +41,45 @@    specifications with minimal number of packages. Resulting specification is 
    similar to `conda env export --from-history`, but also includes packages 
    that were installed using `pip`.
  doc_url: https://github.com/olegtarasov/conda-export
  dev_url: https://github.com/olegtarasov/conda-export
